title: Dungeon (Construction)

properties.name: description
properties.value:
The dungeon is a room or set of rooms that can be built in the basement of a player-owned house. It can be built at level 70 Construction. The dungeon room, unlike other rooms, can come in 3 different styles, each with their own hotspots, and can be accessed via a skill hall, quest hall, garden, or formal garden. 
The three styles are:

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Dungeon
This article is about the room that members can build in their house. For the underground caves found around Gielinor, see List of dungeons.
For a list of all items and upgrades within the Construction skill, see Construction/Level up table.

The dungeon is a room or set of rooms that can be built in the basement of a player-owned house. It can be built at level 70 Construction. The dungeon room, unlike other rooms, can come in 3 different styles, each with their own hotspots, and can be accessed via a skill hall, quest hall, garden, or formal garden. The three styles are:

  • Corridor
  • Junction (or Cross)
  • Stairs

Each part of a dungeon that is built counts as a room against the total number of rooms a player can have. For example, building a stairs room, a junction, and two corridors counts as four rooms. Some players who wish to build an extensive dungeon often end up removing other rooms they had previously built.

It costs 7,500 to make a corridor, junction, or stairs room. The cheapest way to build a dungeon is to construct a limestone spiral staircase in a quest hall and build stairs leading down. Assuming a quest hall already exists in the house, this would cost 30,000.

There are 7 hotspots available across all dungeon room types:

  • Decoration space
  • Door space
  • Guard space
  • Lighting space
  • Rug space
  • Stair space
  • Trap space

Contents

  • 1 Decoration
  • 2 Door
  • 3 Guard
  • 4 Lighting
  • 5 Rug/Stairs
  • 6 Trap

Decoration[edit | edit source]

Level Decoration Materials Experience Cost
72 Decorative blood Red dye x4 4 1,272
83 Decorative pipe Steel bar x6 120 2,592
94 Hanging skeleton Skull x2
Bones x6 		3 462

Door[edit | edit source]

Players have to pick the lock (using Thieving) or force the lock (using Strength) to open dungeon doors. Higher level doors are more difficult to open.

Level Door Materials Experience Cost
74 Oak door Oak plank x10 600 4,650
84 Steel-plated door Oak plank x10
Steel bar x10 		800 8,970
94 Marble door Marble block x4 2,000 1,328,624

Guard[edit | edit source]

Guards are activated when challenge mode is turned on and will attack nearby players. Spicy stew/Construction tea can be used to boost to the required level. The invisible bonus of the crystal saw does not work.

Level Guard Combat Level Experience Cost
70 Skeleton guard 22 223 50,000
74 Guard dog 44 273 75,000
78 Hobgoblin 54 316 100,000
82 Baby red dragon 65 387 150,000
86 Huge spider 81 447 200,000
90 Troll guard 91 1,000 1,000,000
94 Hellhound 122 2,236 5,000,000

Lighting[edit | edit source]

Level Lighting Materials Experience Cost
72 Candle Oak plank x4
Lit candle x4 		243 3,040
84 Torches Oak plank x4
Lit torch x4 		244 1,880
94 Skull torches Oak plank x4
Lit torch x4
Skull x4 		246 1,880

Rug/Stairs[edit | edit source]

Stairs can be used to connect to a skill hall, quest hall, or a dungeon entrance in a garden or formal garden above.

Level Rug/Stairs Materials Experience Cost
13 Rug Bolt of cloth x4 60 3,848
27 Oak staircase Oak plank x10
Steel bar x4 		680 6,378
48 Teak staircase Teak plank x10
Steel bar x4 		980 10,278
65 Opulent rug Bolt of cloth x4
Gold leaf 		360 139,941
67 Limestone spiral staircase Teak plank x10
Limestone brick x7 		1,040 10,160
82 Marble staircase Mahogany plank x5
Marble block x5 		3,200 1,671,460
97 Marble spiral Teak plank x10
Marble block x7 		4,400 2,333,642

Trap[edit | edit source]

Used as obstacles. There is a chance that when a player steps on a trap, it will not activate. Players with higher Agility levels may also dodge the traps.

Level Trap Experience Cost Effect
72 Spike trap 223 50,000 The victim takes damage and jumps back.
76 Man trap 273 75,000 Does 9-12 damage to the victim.
80 Tangle vine 316 100,000 Grabs the player for about 5 seconds.
84 Marble trap 387 150,000 Lowers victim's agility level.
88 Teleport trap 447 200,000 Teleports the victim to the most valuable oubliette or the one that was first built.

The cheapest way to build a dungeon is to construct a [[limestone spiral staircase]] in a [[quest hall]] and build stairs leading down. Assuming a quest hall already exists in the house, this would cost {{Coins|30000}}.
